content.raw:
When trying to run a singleshot routine (which saves some results), I get the following traceback:

```
#!python

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\threading.py", line 754, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\__main__.py", line 1680, in analysis_loop
    self.do_singleshot_analysis(filepath)
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\__main__.py", line 1718, in do_singleshot_analysis
    self.shots_model.update_row(file, status_percent=status_percent, updated_row_data=updated_data[file])
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 114, in f
    return inmain(fn, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 74, in inmain
    return get_inmain_result(in_main_later(fn,False,*args,**kwargs))
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 94, in get_inmain_result
    exec('raise type, value, traceback')
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 53, in event
    result = event.fn(*event.args, **event.kwargs)
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\__main__.py", line 1300, in update_row
    new_row_data[(group, name)] = updated_row_data[group, name]
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 2419, in __setitem__
    self._set_item(key, value)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 2485, in _set_item
    value = self._sanitize_column(key, value)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 2684, in _sanitize_column
    if broadcast and key in self.columns and value.ndim == 1:
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1042, in __contains__
    self.get_loc(key)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1672, in get_loc
    if lead_key else (0, len(self)))
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1578, in slice_locs
    return super(MultiIndex, self).slice_locs(start, end, step, kind=kind)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\base.py", line 3176, in slice_locs
    start_slice = self.get_slice_bound(start, 'left', kind)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1549, in get_slice_bound
    return self._partial_tup_index(label, side=side)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1594, in _partial_tup_index
    raise TypeError('Level type mismatch: %s' % lab)
TypeError: Level type mismatch: OD_calc

```

(OD_calc is the name of the script running)

This then causes the analysis process to crash, so lyse stops working.
content.html:
When trying to run a singleshot routine (which saves some results), I get the following traceback:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\threading.py", line 754, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\__main__.py", line 1680, in analysis_loop
    self.do_singleshot_analysis(filepath)
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\__main__.py", line 1718, in do_singleshot_analysis
    self.shots_model.update_row(file, status_percent=status_percent, updated_row_data=updated_data[file])
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 114, in f
    return inmain(fn, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 74, in inmain
    return get_inmain_result(in_main_later(fn,False,*args,**kwargs))
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 94, in get_inmain_result
    exec('raise type, value, traceback')
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\qtutils\invoke_in_main.py", line 53, in event
    result = event.fn(*event.args, **event.kwargs)
  File "C:\labscript_suite\lyse\__main__.py", line 1300, in update_row
    new_row_data[(group, name)] = updated_row_data[group, name]
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 2419, in __setitem__
    self._set_item(key, value)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 2485, in _set_item
    value = self._sanitize_column(key, value)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 2684, in _sanitize_column
    if broadcast and key in self.columns and value.ndim == 1:
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1042, in __contains__
    self.get_loc(key)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1672, in get_loc
    if lead_key else (0, len(self)))
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1578, in slice_locs
    return super(MultiIndex, self).slice_locs(start, end, step, kind=kind)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\base.py", line 3176, in slice_locs
    start_slice = self.get_slice_bound(start, 'left', kind)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1549, in get_slice_bound
    return self._partial_tup_index(label, side=side)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\pandas\indexes\multi.py", line 1594, in _partial_tup_index
    raise TypeError('Level type mismatch: %s' % lab)
TypeError: Level type mismatch: OD_calc

(OD_calc is the name of the script running)

This then causes the analysis process to crash, so lyse stops working.
